agilermi.core

Class RMIRegistry.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • agilermi.core.RMIRegistry.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    RMIRegistry

    public static class RMIRegistry.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
    Builder for RMIRegistry. A new instance of this class can be returned by the RMIRegistry.builder() static method. A new instance of this class wraps all the defaults for RMIRegistry and allows to modify them. When the configuration has been terminated, a new RMIRegistry instance can be obtained by the build() method.

    An instance of this class can be re-used after each call to the build() method to generate new instances of RMIRegistry. Each call to the build() method does not reset the builder instance to its default state.
    Author:
    Salvatore Giampa'

    • Method Detail

      • setMultiConnectionMode

        public RMIRegistry.Builder setMultiConnectionMode(boolean multiConnectionMode)
        Enable or disable multi-connection mode. If it is enabled, tends to create new connections for each created or received stub.

        When disabled it tends to share the same TCP connections across all local stubs.

        Default: false
        Parameters:
        multiConnectionMode - true to enable, false to disable
        Returns:
        this builder

      • setStateConsistencyOnFaultEnabled

        public RMIRegistry.Builder setStateConsistencyOnFaultEnabled(boolean stateConsistencyOnFaultEnabled)
        When enabled, this flag ensures that, after a connection fault, a stub will be reconnected with the same remote object instance that existed before the fault. If this is not possible, for instance, due to a crash of the remote JVM process, the stub will be no longer reusable.

        If this is disabled and a new instance of the remote object is re-published, the stub will be reconnected, but, given the state reached by the remote object before the connection fault, there is no guarantee about that it will be the same state after the connection repair.

        Default: false
        Parameters:
        stateConsistencyOnFaultEnabled - true to enable status consistency guarantee on connection fault
        Returns:
        this builder

      • setSkeletonInvocationCacheSize

        public RMIRegistry.Builder setSkeletonInvocationCacheSize(int skeletonInvocationCacheSize)
        Sets the cache size of invocations results for each skeleton. The invocation cache is used to prevent duplicate invocation requests due to connection errors.

        Default: 50
        Parameters:
        skeletonInvocationCacheSize - the max number of invocations return values to store in the cache of the skeleton
        Returns:
        this builder

      • setAutomaticReferencingEnabled

        public RMIRegistry.Builder setAutomaticReferencingEnabled(boolean automaticReferencingEnabled)
        Enables or disables the automatic referencing which is the mechanism that replace all the remote objects with its stubs when they are transmitted over RMI streams.

        When automatic referencing is active and a remote object that was not published on the registry is transmitted as a parameter for a remote invocation or as a return value, it is automatically published on the registry. This mechanism requires that a Distributed Garbage Collector service is active on this node, to remove objects that are not utilized for a time as long as the lease time (see setLeaseTime(int)).

        When the automatic referencing is not active, the framework can be used as a plain old RPC middle-ware, where the Distributed Garbage Collection service is off and no object can be remote without explicitly publishing it on the RMI registry, so that this is a "service oriented" mode.

        Default: true
        Parameters:
        automaticReferencingEnabled - set to true to enable automatic referencig, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        this builder

      • setLeaseTime

        public RMIRegistry.Builder setLeaseTime(int leaseTime)
        Sets the lease timeout after that the distributed garbage collection mechanism will remove a non-named object from the registry.

        Default: 600000 milliseconds (10 minutes).
        Parameters:
        leaseTime - the lease timeout value in milliseconds
        Returns:
        this builder

      • setLatencyTime

        public RMIRegistry.Builder setLatencyTime(int latencyTime)
        Sets an estimate of the TCP connection latency time. This constant is used to determine update times across the RMI network (e.g. when a remote object has zero pointers its removal from registry is scheduled to be executed after the latency time passed).

        Default: 5000 milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        latencyTime - a time in milliseconds
        Returns:
        this builder

      • addCodebase

        public RMIRegistry.Builder addCodebase(java.net.URL url)
        Utility method to add a codebase at building time. Codebases can be added and removed after the registry construction, too.
        Parameters:
        url - the url to the codebase
        Returns:
        this builder
        See Also:
        addCodebase(URL)

      • setClassLoaderFactory

        public RMIRegistry.Builder setClassLoaderFactory(ClassLoaderFactory classLoaderFactory)
        Sets the class loader factory used by this registry to decode remote classes when code mobility is enabled. It is necessary on some platforms that uses a different implementation of the Java Virtual Machine.

        Default: null (uses an instance of URLClassLoaderFactory)
        Parameters:
        classLoaderFactory - the factory to use
        Returns:
        this builder

      • setCodeDownloadingEnabled

        public RMIRegistry.Builder setCodeDownloadingEnabled(boolean codeDownloadingEnabled)
        Enable dynamic code downloading. If code downloading is enabled, this registry will accept and download code from remote code-bases.

        Default: false
        Parameters:
        codeDownloadingEnabled - true if the dynamic code downloading must be enabled, false otherwise
        Returns:
        this builder

      • setAuthenticator

        public RMIRegistry.Builder setAuthenticator(RMIAuthenticator rmiAuthenticator)
        Set an RMIAuthenticator object that intercept authentication and authorization requests from remote machines. Default: null (no RMIAuthenticator)
        Parameters:
        rmiAuthenticator - the RMIAuthenticator instance to use
        Returns:
        this builder

      • setSocketFactories

        public RMIRegistry.Builder setSocketFactories(javax.net.SocketFactory socketFactory,
                                              javax.net.ServerSocketFactory serverSocketFactory)
        Sets the socket factories that the registry will use.

        Default: default socket factories provided by the JDK
        Parameters:
        socketFactory - the SocketFactory instance to use to build client sockets
        serverSocketFactory - the ServerSocketFactory instance to use to build the listener server socket
        Returns:
        this builder

      • setProtocolEndpointFactory

        public RMIRegistry.Builder setProtocolEndpointFactory(ProtocolEndpointFactory protocolEndpointFactory)
        Sets the ProtocolEndpointFactory instance to use in the registry to build.

        Default: null (no protocol customization)
        Parameters:
        protocolEndpointFactory - the ProtocolEndpointFactory instance that gives the ProtocolEndpoint instance in which the underlying communication streams will be wrapped in
        Returns:
        this builder

      • build

        public RMIRegistry build()
        Builds the RMIRegistry instance. After this call, the builder will not reset and it will be reusable to build new RMIRegistry instances.
        Returns:
        the built RMIRegistry instance
